wikipedia_page.main: Sir Robert Gordon Cooke (29 May 1930 – 6 January 1987) was a British Conservative Party politician.

response: Athelhampton has been owned by three generations of the Cooke family. The property was acquired by Robert Victor Cooke in 1957, who restored the manor; in 1966, he transferred ownership to his son Robert Cooke. In 1995, the property was inherited by Patrick Cooke who arranged for additional restoration and extension of the gardens.One of the most incredible privately-owned homes in Britain has come to the market
*The House was used as a location for the 1972 film Sleuth, when it was owned by Robert Cooke, MP.IMDB database of filming at the house

response: *Robert Cooke (1930–1987), Conservative MP for Bristol West (1957–1979) and Baby of the House (1957–1958)

He married three times; first, in 1962, to Sally (a cousin), whom he divorced in 1987, then to Jennifer (the widow of Robert Cooke, former MP for Bristol West), whom he married in 1990 and was with until her death in 1995. He was declared bankrupt in 1993 and lived for several years in Alderney. As of 2013 he was a resident of Lemona in Cyprus. He died in 2017 and is survived by his third wife, Maureen Hope-Wynne.
